meanings.definition: An isomorphism from a mathematical object to itself.
meanings.sent1: The automorphism of the graph kept all the connections the same.
meanings.sent2: The automorphism of the function maintained its original shape.
meanings.sent3: The automorphism of the puzzle made it look exactly the same.
meanings.sent4: The automorphism of the mirror reflected the image perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The automorphism of the crystal clear water duplicated the scene flawlessly.

meanings.definition: A mapping of a mathematical object onto itself that preserves the structure of the object.
meanings.sent1: The automorphism of the shape retained all its angles and sides.
meanings.sent2: The automorphism of the equation kept the relationships intact.
meanings.sent3: The automorphism of the cookie cutter made cookies identical to each other.
meanings.sent4: The automorphism of the tree replicated its branches and leaves.
meanings.sent5: The automorphism of the painting duplicated every stroke and color perfectly.
